metadata.title: RHSA-2023:6368: qemu-kvm security, bug fix, and enhancement update (Moderate)
metadata.description:
Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM) is a full virtualization solution for Linux on a variety of architectures. The qemu-kvm packages provide the user-space component for running virtual machines that use KVM.

The following packages have been upgraded to a later upstream version: qemu-kvm (8.0.0). (BZ#2180898)

Security Fix(es):

* QEMU: hcd-ehci: DMA reentrancy issue (incomplete fix for CVE-2021-3750) (CVE-2023-2680)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.3 Release Notes linked from the References section.

bugzilla.text: DMA reentrancy issue (incomplete fix for CVE-2021-3750)
